page.title: 10STRETTON SWIMMING POOL
page.content: The{Swimming Pool}is built on the School field and the children from the schools use it during the day. The Church Stretton{Swimming Pool was opened on the 26th of June 1971 by Jasper More, MP for South Shropshire. The cost to build it was Â£19,000. This money was raised by the people of Church Stretton. Before it was a Swimming pool it was a work-house. The old buildings were converted to changing rooms. Local clubs can hire the pool, when the schools are not using it, for Â£8 per hour. There is a{Swimming Club}which runs sessions nearly every evening. There are courses for beginners, improvers, synchro, diving, life saving and canoeing. Admission costs 50p for adults (75p for non-members) and 25p for children (35p for non-members) for 1 hour.
